subject: World Cup (Skiing)
lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn finished third in a World Cup downhill Sunday in Zauchensee, Austria, good enough to regain the lead in the overall standings. Vonn, the defending overall and downhill champion, trailed the co-winners, Anja Paerson of Sweden and Dominique Gisin of Switzerland, by 17-hundredths of a second. They each finished the 1.83-mile Kaelberloch course in 1 minute 47.52 seconds.
